label: Description
value: A standing Turkish lady, facing frontally, with a water pipe beside her. She stands on a small rug. Remarque of a twig with blossoms.

value: Edmond C. Bonaventure; 1951: Acquired by Museum

value: Edmond C. Bonaventure; 1951: Acquired by Museum
The Entrance of Charles V Into Antwerp

label: Description
value: A large gathering witnesses the entry of Charles V on horseback. He gestures to a nude female slave nearby.

The Children of Charles I of England

label: Description
value: The three small children of Charles I are seen standing with a large pet dog on a carpet strewn with roses.

label: Description
value: A Spanish inquisition scene, with an elderly man forced to kneel and take an oath, in the presence of a gathering of dignitaries, including a Queen (Isabella?). Remarque of a head of an elederly man seen in profile.

label: Provenance
value: Edmond C. Bonaventure; 1951: Acquired by Museum
The Gallery of H.M.S. Calcutta (Souvenir of a Ball on Shipboard)

label: Description
value: Two women and a gentleman are shown standing on the deck of a ship leaning against the rail at right. In the distance, a view of a harbor with ships.

value: Edmond C. Bonaventure; 1951: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A group of six merchants are before a table spread with a rug. Two hold a book open before them. Inscribed, upper right: "Rembrandt f. 1661."

value: Edmond C. Bonaventure; 1951: Acquired by Museum
My Heart Balances Between The Two

label: Description
value: In the foreground a small boat is partially seen. In the boat a man in Highlander's uniform, is seated between two young women. Battleships in background.

value: Edmond C. Bonaventure; 1951: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: An outdoor scene. A young girl stands, facing the spectator, her left hand resting on her hip; her right hand holding a fan which is raised to the height of her face.

label: Provenance
value: Edmond C. Bonaventure; 1951: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A young woman, shown three-quarter length, is seated, her head turned to right. In her right hand she holds an open umbrella.

label: Provenance
value: Edmond C. Bonaventure; 1951: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A young woman is seated in a hammock, reading a book. A small bamboo table is seen in foreground, lower left. At lower right, an open umbrella.

label: Provenance
value: Edmond C. Bonaventure; 1951: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A garden with a woman seated on the grass, at left. Four children seated and reclining, left to right. A woman and a small boy walking in background.

label: Provenance
value: Edmond C. Bonaventure; 1951: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value:
Formerly a square chalice cover, now cut in half on the diagonal, in linen punto in aria needle lace. Showing the device of the Borghese Family, the Agnus Dei and the eagle with wide-spread wings.  The letters:  ECCE AGNUS DEI ECCE O ... appear in half-circle.

Inscription: ECCE AGNUS DEI QUI TOLLIT PECCATUM MUNDI (Behold the Lamb of God who takes away the sins of the world)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Notes
value: Formerly a square chalice cover, now cut in half on the diagonal, in linen punto in aria needle lace. Showing the device of the Borghese Family, the Agnus Dei and the eagle with wide-spread wings. The letters: ECCE AGNUS DEI ECCE O ... appear in half-circle.

label: Description
value: Narrow woolen tape with simplified "S" repeats, sometimes turning into scrolls, sometimes with single curve; replaced 1/3 way through with strip of five diamonds with dot in center of each. Red on blue, one side; blue on red, others. At each end, strands loosely plaited for 0M450, then separated into two thinner plaits. "0M075" one end, "0M205" on other.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 508 x 0.6 cm (16 ft. 8 in. x 1/4 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Agnes M. O'Donnell

label: Description
value: Narrow slit tapestry strip with adjacent diagonal stepped repeats in white, rose reds, browns, golden yellow. One end finished with attached long tassel of brown wool yarns joined at top by a small piece of plaited casing, and the other with a wound casing in yellow, brown, red wool.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool weft Technique: slit tapestry

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Agnes M. O'Donnell

label: Description
value: Long narrow wool band with series of "S" repeats, series of angular scroll repeats, and series of rectangular repeats made up of triangles, in dark green, red, white; framed top and bottom with green, yellow, brown guard stripes.  Warps at each end plaited in two strips which merge into single thicker plait after 1"; separate again 1" from end and terminate in 4" fringe; chevron striped in plaited area from different warp colors.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool Technique: woven tape with braided ends

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 300 x 1 cm (9 ft. 10 1/8 in. x 3/8 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Agnes M. O'Donnell

label: Description
value: Large tassel with long heavy twisted red wool fringes and wool yarn stretched in 1/4" band of white, red, green, yellow over the top of the core, and a thick stiff stem of cotton yarns wound tightly with cotton threads over which stem stitch appears to have been worked in a design of geometrical rosettes, with a diamond center, in black, red, white, yellow wool ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique: twisted fringe, embroidered cord

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Agnes M. O'Donnell

label: Description
value: Strip of un-dyed cotton cloth with band containing angular scrolls in cloth weave on twined background; guard strips; cord selvage on one side, to which is hand-sewn fringed border.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: plain weave with gauze weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Agnes M. O'Donnell

label: Description
value: Length (ripped from a skirt) of cream colored cotton, block-printed in desgin of thin flower sprays, with pointed leaves, small wild flowers, and sprays bearing print (strawberries (?)). colors red, blue, yellow, plum color, and darkbrow for stems, Both selvages present.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: block printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: Cream colored cotton, block-printed in design of flowers and delicate intertwining garlands of thin pointed leaves and stems. Blossoms show remains of Indian influence. Some appear to be carnations. Colors red, blue, sepia for stems, and violet. No selvages.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: block printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: White ground printed in a Chinoiserie design in red, blue and violet with a picotage background. Design shows two Chinese boys, one with a bird, seated below an arch formed by two formal trees in planters. Suspended head down from a cord between the trees is a duck. Above is a vase with feathers and flowers.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: block printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: Border for an alb. Very sheer white cotton; embroidered in white cotton. Design symmetrically arranged, of delicate flowering vine, originating in an urn; below dogs and lions rampant, above birds. Second motif: shield with figure of a child on a wheel. Above shield, helmet with closed visor.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton on cotton Technique: embroidery

label: Description
value: Rectangular piece for a cap with a double row of close-set medium scale floriated crosses in green, yellow, blue, tan and black silks with alternating silver or black centers on a red wool ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, silk, cotton, linen, silver foil on silk core Technique: slit tapestry

label: Description
value: Rectangle of plaid with broad central vertical blue band and widely spaced horizontal and vertical stripes in green, yellow, blue, white, on a dark red ground. Horizontal band near bottom with geometrical pattern of diamond S-shapes in cerise, red, yellow, blue, green, purple, white and black twill.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, silk, cotton, linen, silver foil on silk core (1952) Technique: evensided twill; fancy twill on band (1952)

label: Description
value: Man's coat of white cotton, lined with white linen, with deep cuff ornamentation, all of white quilting with sections of punched work and embroidered French knots. The design is an elaborate flower pattern common during the early 18th century.  The shoulder seams, the uneven placing of design in the back and interception of pattern at the neck would indicate that this back has been added from something else, probably a waistcoat, and that this coat has been recut.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (Height of Center back; Shoulder Width): 86.4 × 36.8 cm (34 in. × 14 1/2 in.)

label: Description
value: Soldiers are greeted on their return home. An elderly women grasps the arm of a soldier, at right. At left, a young woman embraces a soldier. In the background, a soldier lifts a young child.

label: Physical description
value: Wood engraving in black ink on paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. Abram S. Hewitt

label: Description
value: A group of soldiers converging towards the center of the composition. A man, at left, has just kicked the football; another has fallen, in the foreground. Tents and figures in the background.

label: Physical description
value: Wood engraving in black ink on paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. Abram S. Hewitt
Interior View, Augustin Daly's Theater, New York

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle.  View of the interior, taken from the first balcony, looking toward the orchestra and the stage.  Three tiers of boxes flank the stage.  A play in progress, showing details of a stage set.  Title below.

label: Physical description
value: Black ink on heavy white paper

label: Dimensions
value: 271 X 322 mm ( plate line), 290 X 344 mm (paper)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Leonard Bloch in memory of Mrs. Laura Barkus

label: Description
value: Fragmented and incomplete depictions of a two lions in profile view, in light green, light blue, cream, brown, and gold.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and gold thread on cotton ground Technique: split-stitch embroidery on warp-faced plain weave

label: Description
value: Woven silk textile with “bizarre” pattern showing large flowers and leaves against a background of architectural motifs including a balustrade and paved path with planter.

label: Description
value: Handle in wood with three ivory fittings for viewing phenakistiscope discs.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Rectangle of "Tapestry Brussels" carpeting with large flowers and leaves in deep rich colors in blurred impressionistic style.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, bast fiber Technique: uncut loops of a printed warp secured in a plain weave foundation

label: Description
value: Length of "Tapestry Brussels" carpeting with rich, large-scale floral and leaf pattern with very long repeat, in shades of red, pink, blue, green, mauve, brown, grey, and beige in blurred impressionistic style.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: worsted wool, jute Technique: uncut warp loops on compound cloth ground

label: Description
value: Length of deep red velvet with a symmetrical design of ogees formed by long scalloped leaves emerging from large flower heads, in silver gilt twill. Delicate twining stems, leaves and flowers in red satin weave fill the background.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, silver gilt strips on silk thread Technique: supplementary warp pile (velvet)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Notes
value: Length of deep red velvet with a symmetrical design of ogees formed by long scalloped leaves emerging from large flower heads, in silver gilt twill. Delicate twining stems, leaves and flowers in red satin weave fill the background.

label: Description
value: Valance fragment in white cotton with a printed design of fantastical flower sprays, serrated leaves and blossoms showing influence of Pillement. Colors are red, blue and light purple. Quilted using intersecting diagonals to create diamond shapes. Interlined with wool.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, linen, wool Technique: relief printed on plain weave with chain stitch quilting

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase in memory of Mrs. Cadwalader Jones

label: Description
value: Panel with diagonal repeats of large flowering plants with smaller flowers on a tan satin ground. Black outlines and black steams with leaves and blossoms in color combinations of orange, green, grey, and tan. Two wide blue-green selvedges with dark blue and red pencil stripe at outer edge.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread (silver foil on a silk core) Technique: cut and voided supplementary warp pile in 5-harness satin foundation with supplementary weft (velvet)

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metal thread Technique: velvet, voided with supplementary weft

label: Description
value: Woven silk textile fragment with tangent roundels containing regardant griffins, with a border of stylized floral motifs and symmetrical interlaced stems. In green on rust ground, silver gilt heads brocaded.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic (silvered gilt vellum wrapped around silk core) Technique: compound woven with discontinuous supplementary wefts (brocade)

label: Description
value: Sheet of paper pasted with double row of samples of fulled wool in bright colors, dark greens and purples, and white from Carcassonne, France. Intended for export to the eastern Mediterranean region.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: paper and wool Technique: fulled plain weave

label: Description
value: Fragment, very fine white cotton, plain cloth, probably Indian, embroidered in detached flower designs, natural size, in wool. Yellow, red, orange, rose, white. Chain stitch. Selvage at left side.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: crewel wool on cotton Technique: chain stitch embroidery on plain weave
